name: MKOverlayPathRenderer
desc: The visual representation of a path-based overlay.

items.name: var path: CGPath!
items.desc: The path representing the overlay’s shape.

items.name: func createPath()
items.desc: Creates the path for the overlay.

items.name: func invalidatePath()
items.desc: Updates the path associated with the overlay renderer.

items.name: var fillColor: UIColor?
items.desc: The fill color to use for the path.

items.name: var strokeColor: UIColor?
items.desc: The stroke color to use for the path.

items.name: var lineWidth: CGFloat
items.desc: The stroke width to use for the path.

items.name: var lineJoin: CGLineJoin
items.desc: The line join style to apply to corners of the path.

items.name: var lineCap: CGLineCap
items.desc: The line cap style to apply to the open ends of the path.

items.name: var miterLimit: CGFloat
items.desc: The limiting value that helps avoid spikes at junctions between connected line segments.

items.name: var lineDashPhase: CGFloat
items.desc: The offset (in points) at which to start drawing the dash pattern.

items.name: var lineDashPattern: [NSNumber]?
items.desc: An array of numbers specifying the dash pattern to use for the path.

items.name: func applyStrokeProperties(to: CGContext, atZoomScale: MKZoomScale)
items.desc: Applies the receiver’s current stroke-related drawing properties to the specified graphics context.

items.name: func applyFillProperties(to: CGContext, atZoomScale: MKZoomScale)
items.desc: Applies the receiver’s current fill-related drawing properties to the specified graphics context.

items.name: func strokePath(CGPath, in: CGContext)
items.desc: Draws a line along the specified path.

items.name: func fillPath(CGPath, in: CGContext)
items.desc: Fills the area enclosed by the specified path.

items.name: var shouldRasterize: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean that determines if the overlay is rendered as a bitmap before compositing.
